pros:
Teaching hospitals, therefore students (nurses and physicians) get to see a lot and learn a lot too. Very interesting cases and patients. Never a dull moment. They hire new grad nurses, so apply while they are on a hiring spree. 

Some of the DMC hospitals, such as Harper Hospital, are Magnet Hospitals.  Most of their registered nurses hold bachelor degrees in nursing. 

Downtown Detroit area is nice and lively. Food is great in and around the area. 

Chick-fil-A in Harper Hospital lobby; Starbucks; Dunkin Donuts; Menchies; Kabobs; and Sushi. Detroit Receiving food court has Subway, Hungry Howies, and Bigby Coffee. 

Cops/Security at the DMC is on point. They are always there to help staff with car trouble, after hours shuttle calls, if you need a police escort to walk to your car late at night, etc..
cons: Staffing on nights could be better for both RN and PCA. Morning crew get way more staff and resources; it would be great if the same could be said for the night shift.

pros: Good benefits. I pay 117.00 every two weeks single person, platinum plan. 401k, raises yearly. I've been here four years and make 18.94. Starting pay is 16.94.
cons: Union seniority keeps you from getting full time. Basically if you get full time, you can be bumped. Your job is always on the line unless you're a nurse.
Short staffed, not safe, always cutting budgets, poor politics.

pros: Good staff, good environment, in the city

cons: Not a great work environment, giant roaches

pros: This is the place where you learn
cons: Too busy, lower pay, benefits could have been better

pros: They give you health insuarance for one person is $64 every two weeks. Thats the platinum plan.
cons: Everything else, literally. You will have the title of telemetry associate and you will actually be a unit clerk who does EVERYTHING, but you dont get paid the rate of a unit clerk. Our floor is filled with roaches, HUGE roaches. They have sprayed and sprayed. They come up from the drains in the bathroom and run around the halls and patients rooms. One patient woke up with one crawling on her arm. The working atmosphere is hostile, no team work. They literally tell the boss on eachother. Im not a part of that as much because I am clerical. GOOD place to get your foot in the door and leave DMC.

pros: The staff is extremely knowledgeable and work well as a ream.
cons: The OR staff works harder than and other hospital OR staff around. We pull all of our own supplies, have to chase our own instruments around, CPD is not functional to supply 4 huge hospital OR's and,  PAY IS TOO LOW! Forced overtime

job_title: Telemetry Associate/Unit Clerk in Detroit, MI
pros: Good pay, hard working nurses, relatively easy work. Cardiac floors are more difficult because you do secretarial work and the monitors have to be watched VERY closely.
cons: A lot of homeless patients, a lot of ungratedul demanding patients who are verbally abusive, sometimes physically (they try) and a lot of mentally ill people. HUGE roaches, bed bugs, and/or fleas throughout the units.

review_title: Tenet is out of touch with employees
job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Detroit, MI
pros: I have a new job at a better hospital starting next week. I will never work for this company again.
cons: What did they give us for risking our lives to fight the COVID virus, they stopped matching our 401K. They received 18 million from the government, and pocket the money. PPEs were lacking unless you were on the units they cuddle. Clean floors (non-COVID) had hand sanitizer, and the COVID floors had nothing. I heard that nurses made face shields for protection and paid for the supplies. Ancillary staff sit around and tell the nurses what to do.

pros: Some of the Pros working at Harper is the vast amount of cross training that you will receive.
cons: One major Con for working at Harper is that there is no room for advancement.  Promotions are based off of who you know, and not on job performance.

review_title: one of the greatest places to work for very staff and patient oriented, The management team is very willing to help.
pros: Staff and department very patient oriented as well as institution.
cons: area of location is a challenge with activity in Detroit

job_title: Patient Care Associate in Detroit, MI
pros: Great experience if you want to advance your career in health care. You learn a lot and will be very prepared for other jobs in health care.
cons: Constantly short staffed. Heavy work load.

pros: i like it there some nice people. the caffeterria food is off the hook
cons: not to many black people, the white man be running this place

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Detroit, MI
pros: Harper is a good place to learn
cons: Lacks team work and communication with CNAs

job_title: ICU Registered Nurse in Detroit, MI
cons: Pay is one of the lowest in the area.

pros: Good place to begin getting experience
cons: Work short staffed without proper supplies
